item.description:
In FAT STACKS, you and your friends compete to build the tallest and tastiest pancake stack! Use classic pancake flavors and toppings, as well as some ~special~ ingredients other chefs wouldn’t dare to use!

The game begins by drawing 4 cards and a buttermilk pancake. Begin your turn by choosing one of three options: draw 2 cards and play 2 cards from your hand, only draw 3 cards, or only play 3 cards. Players create stacks of pancakes by playing Pancake and Topping cards from their hand. Players can place positive cards on their own stacks, and play negative cards to sabotage other players' stacks.

In order for your beautiful (or disgusting) stack to earn a final score, you must top off the stack with a Finisher card. These special cards are placed in the center of the table and are earned by completing the objective on each card. 
 When a finisher is played, it's special effect triggers immediately and your stack's points are locked in which prevents the stack from being sabotaged by other players. Any stacks that don't have finishers on them at the end of the game don't earn any points. This includes stacks that have a negative total value! The game ends when the deck runs out of cards.

At the end of the game, special Trophy cards are awarded to players for bonus points. These cards are given to the player with the tallest, finished, pancake stack, the player with the fewest negative items on their stack, and the player who dealt the most damage in one turn. The points are added up, and the player who earned the most points the end of the game, wins!

FAT STACKS works best with 3-6 players, takes about 40 minutes for a full game, and is recommended for ages 14+.

-description from publisher

name.value: Reunification: A Letter-Writing Game about Reconciliation

item.description:
Your country has been deeply embedded in a tumultuous civil war for many years. Homes have been destroyed, lives torn apart, and families separated—including yours. Your family was divided at the beginning of the war, destroying any possible contact over the subsequent years. Finally, the opposing sides within your country have begun talks, and reconciliation is happening. Over the coming months, you are encouraged by the government to write letters to your family. In a year, the walls will be torn down, and citizens will begin the arduous process of coming together, finally giving you the opportunity to reunite with your long-lost family.

But do you even know them anymore?

Reunification is a game for 3-5 players where each player takes on the role of one member of a family that has been split apart due to a civil war. Throughout the game, you will ask questions of the other family members in order to get to know them and build up familiarity, empathy, and compassion with each other. It is a game of questioning and writing—in hopes of gaining insight and perspective, understanding and trust.

Through their answers to questions, players are creating and telling a story about the world they have created and the family they belong to.

In Dizzle, players want to fill their scorecards with dice collected each round. Players take turns selecting dice from the center of the table, and the next die they collect must match the others. At the end of a round, mark all boxes on your scorecard filled with dice.

This might sound simple, but of course others will compete for the dice you need...

item.description: Who can clap their hands under one leg, move like an "aviator", wave their arms and legs in a circle, or do the "dog"? In Turn-Domino, you lay out the tiles so that the colors match, then do what's shown on the tiles.

En Garde Reforged is a cinematic action card game for 2-6 impeccably dressed Renaissance-era duelists engaged in a pitched clifftop melee. Players must attempt to out maneuver their opponents in a series of one on one duels to prove their technique reigns supreme. Carefully manage your cards and keep calm, cool and collected if you hope to win the day. If you’re attacked at the wrong moment, prepare to taste cold steel!

Each turn the active player will draw a hand of cards, arming themselves with new items and/or restoring their Poise in preparation for the upcoming duel. That player will then begin an Exchange with a player of their choosing by using an Attack card. The way their opponent chooses to defend themselves (or not) may result in a flurry of attacks and counter attacks between the two players, exhausting their Poise in a flurry of flashing thrusts, slashes and lunges. If either player gets hit with an attack while they are at No Poise, they are eliminated from the game!

Be the last player standing after a series of ferocious duels and you win!

The basic concept of the game of ACQUISITIONS is that the players create and grow Kingdoms by playing the Destination Cards in their hand and placing buildings on the board. The Destination Cards available to the player are provided strictly by the luck of the draw. The skill in the game of Acquisitions, to generate a large amount of Commodity Coins, comes from the ability to obtain Kingdom Cards in the Kingdoms that will grow or even in the Kingdoms that are taken over by larger Kingdoms. The obtaining of Kingdom Cards is generally made in Kingdoms based on the players’ capability to grow those Kingdoms with their cards on hand. However, players can increase their Commodity Coins by obtaining Kingdom Cards in Kingdoms that grow from the other players building placement.

The main objective of Acquisitions is to become the player with the most Commodity Coins at the end of the game. This is achieved by obtaining Kingdom Cards in the Kingdoms that are growing, for a long term venture, while at the same time shrewdly investing in smaller Kingdoms that can be sacrificed in takeovers, for a short term outlay, all of which gains Commodity Coins through Royalty Compensations. The more Commodity Coins that can be generated in short term outlays, the more they can be invested into long term ventures. The perfect balance is needed to be crowned the reigning King or Queen of Acquisitions.

-description from designer

Overload is a racing game in which players try to score as many points as possible over several laps. At the start of the game, each player decides how many discs to place on their figure. The more discs you have, the more you score! Whenever someone passes you during the race, you add another disc to your figure — but if you collect too many discs, then you go out of control and need to start the lap again...

In the village of Tiefenthal lies "The Tavern of the Deep Valley". There, all citizens from the area gather, but it's important to attract new, wealthy guests for only then is there enough money to expand the tavern, which will then lure nobles into the tavern as well. But which tavern expansion is best? Should you focus on money? Or rather ensure that the beer will keep flowing?

In Die Tavernen im Tiefen Thal, the challenge is to skillfully choose the dice and develop your personal deck of cards as profitably as possible. The game is structured with five modules so that each player can set their desired level of difficulty.

item.description:
Kniffel Dice Duel plays like the standard Kniffel dice game, a.k.a. Yahtzee, in that players roll the dice three times on their turn and try to score for various dice combinations. The big difference in this game is that when you score a combination, you receive a scoring chip that shows those points — and if no more chips remain for that combination, then you don't receive those points!

Roll five-of-a-kind, and you collect a 50-point Kniffel chip, then take another turn immediately. Good luck!

So typisch! is a co-operative and communicative game full of stereotypes and clichés! All players fight together for the victory and play against the game. Each round, a single player decides which item to assign to a person, then everyone else must assess how this player has decided. In the end, players win only if they've made more matches than mistakes.

item.description:
Doppelt so clever follows the model of 2018's Ganz schön clever. Each turn the active player rolls six dice, chooses one of them to mark off a space on their scoring grid, places any dice with lower numbers on the side, then re-rolls any remaining dice. The white die is a joker and can be used as any one of the other five colors. After the active player chooses at most three dice, then the other players chooses one of the set-aside dice for use on their scoring sheet.

Doppelt so clever has five new dice-marking challenges and a new action beyond the re-roll and "use one more die" actions of the earlier game.

item.description:
Squeezamals Freeze 'N' Squeeze Game is a twist on the classic game of hot potato. Players take turns making a yummy treat for their Squeezamal to enjoy, and the player caught holding the plush when it's time to eat must pay for the treat! Each game features an exclusive Squeezamal! Colors and styles may vary.

—description from the publisher

Recruit your heroes, build your unit, and take your forces to battle against your opponent in a light-yet-deep tactical duel. This set contains cards previously out of print from the Pixel Tactics minipacks, but are updated and now together in one box.

—description from the publisher

link.value: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Mega Man Blue
Pixel Tactics: The Price Of Victory

item.description:
A co-operative game for 1 to 4 players. Each player is a key officer on a U-Boat with an associated special action.

Each turn cards are drawn (one at a time) and placed in numbered spaces along an operations track at the top of a board. The crew commander then rolls two die and refers to the card in the space than number represents. If the card does not relate to the current action state of the U-boat. Nothing happens and play proceeds to the next turn and action state.

If the card mentions the current action state, it's instructions are followed.

The goal is to survive four missions of differing difficulty without loosing a crew member or the U-boat.

-description from designer

Selfie Speed is a fast-paced game in which players compete to be the first to match their frames to the selfie cards. 
The player who makes the most selfies wins!

 Choose a set of transparent slides with the same frame color.




Pull 5 selfie cards out of the pile and place them in a row in the center of the table.

 All players simultaneously place their slides on as many matching selfie cards as possible.
 The player who makes the most selfies wins!




—description from the designer

Wargame rules designed to fight battles during the Sudanese colonial campaigns to relieve Gordon at Khartoum and then to re-conquer the Sudan. 
These rules are intended to be used with 15mm-scale figures mounted on two-figure stands. They are very basic, and follow a simple sequence of actions (orders, movement, fire, melee, retreat).

Wargame rules written so that small colonial battles in colonial Sudan could be fought as ‘one offs’ or as part of a campaign. Intended for 15mm-miniatures. Heavily based on the same system of De Bellis Antiquitatis, with a simple game sequence of movement, fire, melee.

Find all the fish which are hidden below the water lilies.
Take all the 9 water lily tokens. Turn water lily tokens face down (fish can't be visible): shuffle them and place them randomly on the rotating area of the board. Each player choose a colour, take the corresponding fish token and place it on the scorekeeper on the 0 slot. At his turn, each player rolls the dices: he should choose between the 2 colours of the dices and rotate the swamp till the firefly stops in front of the insect of that colour. Then, the player turns 2 water lily tokens in order to find the correct fish indicated by the dices.
Did you find the correct fish? Place tokens back face down and move your marker for 3 slots on the scorekeeper.
Did you find only one correct fish? Place tokens back face down and move your marker for 1 slot on the scorekeeper.
Did you find both wrong fish? Place tokens back face down in the swamp and your turn ends.
Did you find a black fish, but the dices didn't show that colour? You can't move on your scorekeeper.
Attention: If you get the green colour after rolling the dice, ask another player which fish you should search for.
Game ends when a player reaches 9 points slot on his scorekeeper.

—user summary

A strategy game whose object is to collect the greatest number of vegetables in your fields. Players take turns drawing cubes from the bag
and creating a 5x5 grid by putting them next to each other. Each player chooses a vegetable to collect and tries to collect as many vegetables as possible within one or more fields.
The player with the most vegetables in their fields wins. What strategy will you choose? Add a maximum number of vegetables to your fields or try and block your opponents from collecting theirs?

 Take out the 25 cubes from the tray and place them in the bag. Each player chooses a vegetable to collect, picks a cube and attaches it to the grid.
 The strategy is always whether to add maximum vegetables or to try and block opponents.
 The player with the greatest number of vegetables in their field wins. In the sample the player with the carrot field is the winner!




—description from the publisher

A fast-paced fun game in which players compete to be the first to make the sound of an animal or call the name of a fruit.
The player who wins the most cards wins!

 Place all cards in a pile face down.
 One of the players rolls the dice and a card from the pile is flipped over.
 There are 3 possible ways to win a card. The player with the most cards by the end of the game – wins!




—description from the publisher

Crown War is a quick and fun game. 
Pick up the highest value crown to win each round, pile up your winnings. The player with the highest pile – wins the game.

 Before the game begins, mix the coins and place them on the table, facing down.
 All players pick 1 coin simultaneously. The player with the highest value coin wins the round, and collects his friend's coins.
 When all coins in the center are gone, or when there are less coins than the number of players, compare players piles.




The player with the highest pile wins the game! It is recommended to play 5 games in a row, and the winner in most games is The Champion.

—description from the publisher

This game is a fully cooperative game,
people are running along a spiral path and are trying to open 8 wooden doors in order to get out of a dungeon.
Its contents consists of 250 distinct challenges.
Each step to open a door requires to cooperate and develops team competence and spirit in the following fields.


 better knowledge of himself and the others
 self-esteem and group confidence
 creative expression, developing creativity and imagination 
 feelings: expressing feelings and emotions (not judgements)
 listening: observing and listening others in order to better understand his way of life
 cooperation: experimenting with cooperation in order to better understand its advantages compared to competition and concurrence


The game requires some extra material not included in the box
pencil and paper sheets
according to the challenges : players may need, objects from the room, scissors, scotch tape, clothes, blindfold, scarf, rope, watch with seconds, bag,...

—description from the publisher

The Emperor is dead. The law says that if there is more than one heir to the throne, a Lunar War must take place in order to determine the new ruler of the Empire.

The Lunar War will last for 29 days, 12 hours, 44 minutes and 3 seconds – one full lunar cycle of the long forgotten planet Earth.

The warfare will rage on the specially designated, uninhabited sector located at the frontiers of the Empire. The ancient, automatic factories and shipyards will be opened again, for the first time in many decades. The right of succession will depend on the shrewdness, skills and courage of the Fleet commanders and on their strategically distributed forces.

The best will win and throw the corpses of their fallen enemies beneath the throne of the new, victorious emperor!

Lunation is a game based on numerous negative interactions between the players and area control elements. During the seven turns of the game, the players explore space, obtain Systems, build Fleets and recruit Characters in order to pulverize their enemies with procured resources and pure military force.

Become the ruler of the Empire!
Lunation is a dynamic game about space conquest and war. The players’ task is to claim the throne of the Empire. They fight each other to determine one person powerful enough to seize the power.

During the seven turns of the game, the players explore planetary Systems, build Fleets and recruit Characters in order to subdue their opponents with collected resources or pure military power.

Simple and comprehensible: Lunation is not complicated in terms of rules and it is easy to learn;
Negative interactions: apart from trading, virtually all other aspects of the interaction between the players lead to bloodshed;
High replayability: due to the considerable number of cards, a draft system “embedded” into the game preparation process and numerous diversified strategies leading to victory, no two games will be the same;
Dynamic combat: Lunation players use special dice that make it possible to quickly determine the result of the confrontation (without any counting!). Moreover, Action Cards, special properties of the Characters and a certain special feature of the dice add some elements of uncertainty to the result of each battle;
Many ways to win: combat is not the only method that can be used to obtain the highest number of Victory Points and eternal glory – a player can also win by fulfilling Secret Goals and gathering Resources!

—description from the publisher

Phase 10 Strategy is played over several rounds, in which players in turn move their tiles across the board to form card combinations called "phases". Players need to plan their moves well, as they can only form a phase if their counter is in the appropriate space. In addition, a player may only make one phase per round. Once a player has completed a full phase and got rid of his remaining cards, the round ends. Then all players get new cards and the next round begins. Whoever completes his tenth phase first and then gets rid of his remaining cards, wins! Each deck contains Joker cards which increase the suspense and help players escape a tricky situation.

—description from the publisher (Translated)

Phase 10 Strategy wird über mehrere Runden gespielt, in denen die Spieler reihum ihre Spielsteine so über das Spielbrett bewegen, dass sie Kartenkombinationen bilden können, die als „Phasen“ bezeichnet werden. Die Spieler müssen ihre Züge gut planen, da sie eine Phase nur dann bilden können, wenn ihr Spielstein sich auf dem entsprechenden Feld befindet. Außerdem darf ein Spieler pro Runde nur eine einzige Phase bilden. Sobald ein Spieler eine vollständige Phase ausgespielt hat und seine restlichen Karten losgeworden ist, endet die Runde. Dann erhalten alle Spieler neue Karten und die nächste Runde beginnt. Wer als Erster seine zehnte Phase abschließt und dann seine restlichen Karten loswird, gewinnt! Jedes Kartendeck enthält Joker-Karten, die die Spannung steigern und den Spielern helfen können, einer kniffligen Situation zu entkommen.

—description from the publisher (German)

item.description:
In a vast forest, there was a tiny village. The villagers were much like those of any village—they had cut a clearing into the dark chaos of the forest and cultivated a space for the patterns of life to grow. Everyone knew everyone else’s name (and business) and the only dramas in the village were the expected type. In short, it was peaceful. But all that changed when one night a wolf’s cry split the darkness.

Werewolf in the Dark is a game of hidden roles, deception, strategy, and, above all else, survival. When the lights go out some are afraid—they hide and trust to hope. Others know that it is up to them to protect their fellow villagers and drive back the monsters plaguing them. Still others begin to the feel the dark stirrings of a terrible hunger and rise to hunt.

Each Night Round players venture out into the darkness to hide or hunt. The monsters on the Werewolf Team are trying to kill the other players by tapping them covertly on the shoulder until all the villagers are dead. The Villagers are trying to survive the Night Round and gather information about who the monsters are. When the first dead body is found, the lights come on and all players gather together to discuss what happened in the Night Round and vote someone (hopefully a monster) out of the game. The game continues until there are only monsters or villagers left.

—description from the publisher

Players take the role of cartographers that try to remember and build an ancient map.

The game is made of only 9 square tiles, representing parts of a map. Each tile has a land zone and a water zone. One player tries to connect land zones, the other water zones. Every turn they have to decide if they want to rotate a tile or place a new one. When the map is complete, the player who connected the most zones wins.

Chartae is an almost perfect information, minimal but elegant tile placement game, with very easy gameplay but also deep strategy.

Ratto Zakko features fast food for gourmets — but hopefully you can grab the right dishes, despite the changing colors of the hoods that hide the dishes, the rancid cheese or rotten eggs that might await there, and the darn fly that keeps showing up when you least expect it! Who can grab the most delicacies?

item.description:
In this combined deck and bag builder from Brotherwise Games, Evil, Incorporated lets players take the role of super-villains competing to see who can become the most infamous. Players build a deck of plans and resources, recruit special minions, and build an evil lair staffed by those minions. Infamy is acquired over the course of the game, and the player with the most infamy wins!

—description from the publisher

How well do you know your partner?

The game is meant for grown-ups in a relationship, and is played in pairs. The pairs take turns in reading out loud questions or statements, and they have to answer or react to them. If they give the same answer, they get to move on the game board.

There are 4 categories of questions:

 love/eroticism
 home and relationship
 the past and the future 
 money and work




—user summary

item.description:
GRES: DESFILE,is a card game inspired by the Brazilian carnival.

Your aim in the game is to combine the cards so that you accumulate the most points, creating the best samba school parade.

The game is divided into two phases. In the first you collect the cards and combine them the best you can. This phase ends when the first player calls for the results calculation. In the second phase ("Apuração"), players will reveal the cards (show their parades) and the points will be counted. The player with the most points wins.

Be careful! If it rains during your parade or your "Barracão" (art studio) burns down, you lose valuable points. But you can also be lucky and get some money from unconventional sources or have a little help from biased judges. So, prepare your strategy and make a carnival parade to remember!!!

—description from the publisher

Infection Express: Secondary Infection is the second edition of Infection Exress. It is a cooperative 1-6 player dice game inspired by Pandemic.

All that's needed to play are 5 6-sided dice with colored faces, 1 ordinary 6 sided die, 56 4-6mm cubes (14 each of 4 colours), player pawns and a print out of player mats, role cards and game board.
—description from the designer

GAMEPLAY:
On their turn, players move their pawns about, to cure diseases. They then cast dice to research a cure, and to determine where new diseases appear.
The players win the game, once all diseases have been removed from the map, and a cure has been researched for each type of disease. Players cooperate to achieve this goal, but at the end may compare their scores who saved the world the most.

Should there be to many outbreaks, or the infections become too severe, the game is lost.
—user summary

Chaos Kingdoms is a high fantasy board game with an immersive world map. Players take on the role of adventuring Heroes, each with their own set of unique skills and strange character. A Faction of cohorts carry the Hero’s flag, lending their own abilities to their leader. There are 3 legendary goals before them: Last Man Standing, Immortality or Godhood. As they advance, players vanquish rival Heroes, explore dungeons, and spike their power with experience & plunder.

How to WIN:

For lively game play, there are 3 ways to win. 
Last Man Standing: PVP, Player Elimination
Immortality: Battle 4 Jabberwockies to get 4 artifact pieces that grant Immortality
Godhood: Build 5 glorious shrines to yourself in 5 cities

Gameplay:

Game play is relatively simple, making it an easy-entry game for novices. There are 12 Heroes and 12 Factions to choose from, which provides a multitude of strategic combinations. Roll a six-sided dice to travel a classic RPG hex map. Boldly engage with monsters and villains in dungeons and lairs. Battles are a contest of attack rolls with modifiers from pulsing Magic Items and burning Spells. Once powerful enough, conquer fellow Heroes, claim Immortality, or climb into the vaulted existence of a God.

Game Features include:
A multitude of different Hero / Faction combinations
Exploring Dungeons, Ruins, Caves, Hideouts, Towers & more
Unique Artifacts, Weapons & Spells
Fierce PVP and long range attacks
Stealing (very fun and effective)
Targeting opponent Cities
Targeting opponent Items and Followers
Goal: PVP Last Man Standing
Goal: Immortality / Jabberwockies
Goal: Godhood / Shrines
Ruling the World of Chaos Kingdoms

—description from the publisher

You are at a Greek village in 1960, and 6 different candidates try to win the local election with every possible trick and tactic! Stay out of scandals and gossips or try to pin them on others in order to attract the most votes!

Each player takes on a political party which consists of 8 candidates numbered 1 to 8. During each round players pick one of them and places him face down. Then the starting player speaks numbers starting from 1 to 8. If a player has played his number 1 candidate, he says so and takes his turn. He can choose to make as many actions he or she wishes:
- Take a deceitful means token. (once per turn)
- Use the ability of the candidate he or she has just played. (once per turn)
- Pick an Electoral books card or a Coffee house card or a Grocery store card. (once per turn)
- Pay an Electoral books card face up by paying its required deceitful means tokens. (once per turn)
- Play a Coffeehouse card using its ability.
- Play a Grocery store card against another player. This action can be used several times as long as it does not target the same opponent twice.

The player adding up the most votes from his played Electoral books cards wins the election and the game!

Components

199 Cards
6 Vote sheets
61 chips
Rulebook

Abar Depth will take you to a deadly dangerous reef, that most don't come back alive from. Filled with sunken ships and endless caverns it tempts lots of adventurers and artifact seekers. Many end up in a nearby tavern instead though, and play a game of magical dice. Dice, that can tell stories about adventures that were, and these that could have been. And there’s a lot of gold and treasures at stake.

Abar Depth is centered around said game of dice. 2 to 5 players can sit by a table together.

Each person rolls 2 dungeon dice, picks 3 character dice and attempts to defeat others in a game filled with treason, monsters and artifact hunting. Dice belong to different hero classes and offer actions like healing, attacking players or summoning a giant demon.

Gunny Town:
We are in the wild west, during the Gold Rush. A group of bandits enters GunnyTown, a little growing city. Their goal is to become rich and powerful, and they will do absolutely anything to achieve this. Gamblers, contractors, bank robbers, bounty hunters.. What their strategies to grab the town will be? It's up to you!

GunnyTown is a dynamic board game which takes place in far West.
There are no dice to roll or cards to draw before playing,
You're completely free! A very interactive board game!

Rob stores, banks, stay and accumulate bandits missions, become sheriff or get another job, invest in stores, become a bounty hunter, bribe judges or try to get rich playing at the casino! And of Course, buy weapons and fire you opponents!

How To Play :
You move and stop where you want in Town - up to 4 squares, or up to 6 squares if you get a horse.

On each turn you :
- Have to move
- Can take the benefits from a position. You choose between the starting or ending one.
- Can fire at each opponent once.

The goal of the game is to complete some missions and accumulate 12 victory points to win the game!

-description from designer

One throw with both dice and already a combination of 2 colours is lying on the table. Who can find the right child from 21 cards with trousers and jacket in the same colour combination as the thrown dice?
—description from the publisher (translated)

Das kunterbunte Farben-Suchspiel für 2 und mehr Spieler ab 3 Jahren.

Ein Wurf mit den beiden Würfeln - und schon liegt eine Farben-Kombination auf dem Tisch. Wer findet zuerst das richtige Kind unter den 21 Kärtchen, dessen Hose und Jacke der gewürfelten Farbkombination entspricht?
—description from the publisher

name.value: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth
Der Herr der Ringe: Reise durch Mittelerde
The Lord of the Rings: Utazások Középföldén
Le Seigneur des Anneaux: Voyages en Terre du Milieu
El Señor de los Anillos: Viajes por la Tierra Media
Il Signore degli Anelli: Viaggi nella Terra di Mezzo

item.description:
Embark on your own adventures in J.R.R. Tolkien's iconic world with The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth, a fully co-operative, app-supported board game for one to five players! You'll battle villainous foes, make courageous choices, and strike a blow against the evil that threatens the land — all as part of a thrilling campaign that leads you across the storied hills and dales of Middle-earth.

Each individual game of Journeys in Middle-earth is a single adventure in a larger campaign. You'll explore the vast and dynamic landscapes of Middle-earth, using your skills to survive the challenges that you encounter on these perilous quests. As you and your fellow heroes explore the wilderness and battle the dark forces arrayed against you, the game's companion app guides you to reveal the looming forests, quiet clearings, and ancient halls of Middle-earth, while also controlling the enemies you encounter. Whether you're venturing into the wild on your own or with close companions by your side, you can write your own legend in the history of Middle-earth.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
In Superzeroes vs Evil, each player will operate a superzeroes team that will try to overcome evil in all its forms. In this 2-4 player game that last 5 minutes, you'll need to cooperate to achieve your goal.

Players each have a hand composed of 7 cards. At the same time, they will all play a card to create a pool of damage and elements that they will use to kill the threat. If they are not able to defeat the threat, they can play another card or recall their hand and play a new card. Once the threat is defeated, a new one will appear. That goes on until the final boss is revealed!

If you can defeat the boss in under 5 minutes, you'll be the victor! If not, Evil shall prevails and dominate the world.

—description from the publisher

Win Citizen by being the first player to pass your Cause through both chambers of the real 116th United States Congress. All 535 actual members take the place of dice, who are controlled by their documented voting history, seniority, and campaign contributors. Using the framework designed by our founders, advance your Cause or hinder your opponents’ by building Citizen card hands that contain alliances of the actual faces, forces, and fates that built our nation. Use your skills to earn additional powers, all while avoiding the fallout from ambitious opponents, conflicted officials, and unexpected twists of Circumstance cards.

Citizen gives you multiple paths to victory based on a wide variety of strategic considerations including Cause challenge level, deck building and drafting skills, use of powers and other resources during play, hand construction, impact selection, and more. Players' stories intertwine differently with every session so you'll never play the same game twice.

—description from the designer

Sigma the monkey really likes the alphabet and he is trying to learn the letters. Help him find the first letter in words, or the picture of an object that starts with a certain letter.

Bingo meets memory in this game where you help Sigma the monkey to find the letter matching your picture, or the other way around.

First player to fill all their double cards wins

name.value: Hatchimals CollEGGtibles Hatchtastic Jumbo Card Game

item.description:
In the Hatchimals Hatchtastic Jumbo Card Game, you're trying to collect the most egg tokens. To do this, you roll the die and draw cards until one player's cards match the egg color and number on the die. But you have to be fast at grabbing the Hatchimals figure when you find a match or no player wins any tokens. When all the tokens have been taken, count up how many tokens each player has to find the winner.

This game is great for Hatchimals fans. The gameplay is easy to pick up and because the game is in a small package, you can easily bring the game with you for play on the go.

The game also comes with an exclusive Hatchimals figure in an egg.

This pretty game is fun to play and introduces skip counting, the concept behind multiplication. Players learn to count by twos and by fives as they tally the points they collect to win.

The entire deck is dealt out evenly to each player. Players then take turns drawing a random card from the player to their left when it is their turn trying to get and play matching pairs. Once all matching cards have been played, the player holding the remaining fairy queen card (which doesn't have a match) adds that card to their matches. All players then add up the points shown on their cards, and the player with the most points is the winner.

Contents: 48 playing cards (3.25 x 4.5 inches) and instructions

name.value: LOTS: A Competitive Tower Building Game

item.description:
The city is growing every day, with new buildings popping up on every vacant lot. You’ve been hired as a contractor to help develop a skyscraper that will reshape the city’s skyline. If you work hard and plan smart, you can earn the title of Master Builder and be immortalized as part of the city’s rich history.

LOTS is a 3 dimensional puzzle game for 1 to 4 players where contractors are competitively working to build the same tower on a vacant Lot. Players will have to use spatial recognition, color coordination, and just a hint of dexterity to score the most points before the games end.

—description from the designer

Drinking games are fucked! Unless you're some kind of alcoholic super-Chad who shits frat parties or a walking rule book, the games are an impediment to your liquor. And worse yet, if you do manage to eek out a victory, it's the LOSERS who get to drink! Fuck that shit. WINNERS DRINK.

This game was made from a lifetime of sitting around bullshitting in bars and getting kicked out of those bars and getting into heated arguments with people over stupid shit and screwing up with women. If you play this game, those things will probably happen to you.

Players draw a card from the 52 card deck which are comprised of 5 categories: Balls, Contest, Truth Bombs, Rage, and Wild Cards. Balls present you with a social challenge to overcome. A contest will pit you in a challenge against other players. Truth Bomb will reveal more about your friends than you ever thought you'd care to know and you'll learn what minute details of life are causing your friends to feel a rage this week.

Each card type has its own challenge to win at. Players that win a card, keep the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

—description from the publisher

On The Rocks is a 2 to 4 player game by PenTree Games
Designed by Michael and Christina Pittre.

Welcome to On The Rocks cocktail lounge, where only the city's best Mixologist expertly prepares cocktails patrons are craving.

In "On The Rocks" players will select from 3 to 4 drink orders for each of the 3 rounds. Players will then roll the dice and draft that amount of marbles from the shaker bag.

The marbles will then be place in the centralized mixing area bowls one at a time and then select one bowl. All ingredients will be placed on their player board based off the recipe cards.

A tip card will be award to every drink completed over the 3 rounds. The first player to complete all 3 orders will call "Last Call" activating the end game. All players will have one remaining chance to complete their final orders.

Players will add up their final score based off the drinks completed, tips earned and additional tip for completing all orders. Tip cards can either be used in final scoring or use its ability to provide additional ingredients or affect other players.

Player with the most income is the city's best mixologist for the night.

-description from designer

Ragemore is a solo game of Dungeons & Dread, based on 18 cards, which you will use to build a tableau of completed quests, while managing your hand and resources as you delve though the dark, fighting demons, all in a span of 10-15 minutes.

Each card is two sided; a demon and a hero. In the beginning of the game, the player will set up 2 piles of demon-sided quests and a party of 3 hero-sided cards. Then an immediate threat is revealed from the draw deck as the current demon card that may or may not be dealt with. If it is not killed, the demon card will go to one of the quests piles and an event written on that card will take effect. If it is killed, the demon card is flipped to the hero side and becomes one of the party. The player can also ignore the immediate demon threat and goes on a quest to obtain the win condition, or parlay with some of the demons to turn them into heroes but with the cost of the hero's morality: the hero is flipped to the demon side and joins the draw deck of demons.

The game is won when the hero gains the required number of quest card by using a combination of four symbols drawn on each cards. The game is lost when the graveyard has 3 deaths or when a quest pile has 4 demons or the party has no more heroes or the draw deck of demons is empty before the number of quest cards is fulfilled or if the quest piles are empty before the number of quest cards is fulfilled. 1 winning condition and 5 losing conditions.

Treats and tricks! is a fun fast paced game where awesome pets clash in an ever-changing "Chain of Command".

Use your pets wisely to score as many points you can. Ate the end of the game the player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the designer

"Special Edition UNO" with a Coca-Cola theme.

WHAT MAKES THEM DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO:
This version adds a unique "Thirst card" with the following ability: "When this card is played, the player who plays it may select any player to have their thirst quenched. The player selected must draw cards from the deck until he or she draws either a red suited card or any wold card. Upon drawing a red suited card or any wild card the player is to place it in the discard pile. Prior to resuming play the player who plays the card also determines the color to be played in the next round by announcing his/her choice of red, yellow, green or blue."

name.value: Heart and Brain: The Party Game

item.description:
Party card game by the creator of the Heart and Brain comics (aka The Awkward Yeti).

Channel Heart and Brain to defeat your friends in this easy-to-learn ultimate party game! From completely bizarre to extremely logical, this game has it all: trivia, challenges, voting, truth/dare, scenarios/responses. Play Heart and Brain-themed cards and win corresponding game pieces by performing tasks, voting correctly, having the funniest answers and winning challenges. The first player to earn 3 Heart and 3 Brain game pieces is the winner!

description from the designer

In Botanists, players tend a small area of land to grow flowers, which they then hope to sell. As Botanists, each of the players has three small plots of land dedicated to growing the most popular flowers among their usual clients. However, all players obtain the seeds to those flowers from the same supplier, and because not all flowers are equally popular, the supplier only sells the seeds in bundles, on top of that, other Botanists might attempt to snatch certain seeds away from under your nose!

Players take turns in acquiring flowers from the flower market. To do so, they may first move and then play a card that determines what "bundle" they are buying.

With each purchase, players will acquire seeds they are not looking for, so players are required to keep an eye out for open orders to make sure they make the best out of each turn.

Alternatively, players may choose to tend their marginal land (not so fertile), in which case they won't be able to buy new seeds, but instead will be able to trigger a bonus action. In doing so however, players will end up with withered flowers, which will generate negative points at the end of the game.

At the end of their turn, players check the open orders and if they are able to fulfill any of them, they not only earn bonus points, but also get rid of potential negative points.

The game includes

• 1 Main Board
• 5 Player Boards
• 5 Player Tokens (with 1 standee each)
• 5 Score Counters
• 125 Flower Tiles
• 76 Market Cards 
• 82 Order Cards
• 1 Cloth Bag

-description from publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
''SoundTrax is the newest party game for party people. The game is simple. Each round, a director sets the scene by reading a Soundtrax card aloud, and everyone else answers with the funniest or most accurate song that best suits the scene. 

When your song is voted winner of the round, you collect the Soundtrax Card. The first player to collect 3 Soundtrax Cards earns the prestigious Soundtrax Award of Best Director in a Party Role!

—description from the publisher

Play as a squirrel or a chipmunk collecting nuts by matching corresponding die rolls to a card. Then stash cards won by matching numbers or adding up nut cards to equal stash cards. The most nuts stashed along with bonus points at the end wins.

Pen & Paper Football is football without the commercials, endless merchandizing and prison sentences. A few dice and some paper is all you need to simulate an American football game. Just find some friends (or play solo), roll up some teams and pit them against each other in League Play, which requires eight simple dice rolls to play a game, or in Head-to-Head play, which simulates a game play-by-play.

P&PF has all the rules you need to play a whole season of football, with rules for passing, running, kicking, penalties, injuries and even off-season rules for team development. There are dozens of sample teams you can use and handy record sheets for teams, leagues and games.

—description from the publisher

name.value: An Undeniable Victory: Operation Fath-ol-Mobin, March 23-28, 1982

item.description:
An Undeniable Victory is a simulation of Iran’s first large-scale offensive in its war against Iraq. The previous year Iraqi forces had captured large swaths of Iranian territory. With the front line dangerously close to Khorramshahr, the Mullahs in Tehran ordered the Iranian military to launch an offensive at the earliest opportunity to eliminate the threat to this vital Iranian city and production center.

An earlier, smaller Iranian offensive, Operation Hoveyzeh, was easily repulsed by the Iraqis in January. As evidence grew of another Iranian attack, the Iraqis entrenched and awaited their enemy’s actions. Any further offensives by the Iraqis were out of the question until the severe losses in men and material from the previous year could be replaced.

The Iranian offensive in March would be supported by three divisions of the newly created Pasdaran, or revolutionary guards. Composed of youthful recruits, many of them not even out of high school, the Pasdaran was created by the mullahs as a “revolutionary counterweight” to the Iranian military, which the religious leaders suspected of harboring many who were still loyal to the ousted Shah. Much would be at stake at this battle, both at the front and behind the lines.

An Undeniable Victory is a two player game intended to be an easy-to-learn game suitable for new gamers, as well as a challenging and fun contest for veteran Grognards. The game can also be easily played solitaire, however.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Interceptor Ace: Daylight Air Defense Over Germany, 1943-44

item.description:
Interceptor Ace: Daylight Air Defense Over Germany, 1943-44 is a solitaire, tactical level game which places you in command of a German fighter during World War II. Each turn consists of several days, during which a combat mission will be flown from one of many bases in Europe, attempting to intercept incoming American Bombers. Interceptor Ace is based on the popular, action-packed Nightfighter Ace game system by Gregory M. Smith with a strong narrative around the pilot as you look to increase your prestige, earn skills, and rise in rank through promotion and receive awards.

—description from the publisher

link.value: Nightfighter Ace: Air Defense Over Germany, 1943-44

item.description:
Monumentum is an adventure and exploration game. Players each have a set of 12 tiles, each tile has two actions. When player choose them, they can either do one or both of the actions. Three tiles are chosen by each player secretly, then players reveal their actions and take turns executing them. They move over a map board, discovering resources, magic tokens, strange monsters, and reclusive monks that teach new skills. Players can use magic tokens to learn spells, enhance their attributes temporarily and control monsters to hamper other players. Each player attempts to complete 3 honor tasks, to build 4 monuments, build one gold monument, and slay the dragon. The first player to complete these tasks wins. If no player completes all three, the winner is the one with the most points. Points are gained by completing numerous smaller missions during the game.

—description from the publisher

Décollage! is a cooperative card game for 1-6 players. You and your team will have to build rocket launchers to put a maximum of satellites in orbit. You will have to avoid inopportune events and minimize risk on launch day.

Players have to manage their hand of cards to collectively assemble launchers and choose which satellite is more appropriate to launch which satellite. Inopportune events can happen during the launching phase, but players have the opportunity to avoid those events by playing event cards. Satellite launch can succeed or fail and the results of all launches will determine if the players win or lose the game.

Décollage! is produced and published by CNES (Centre national d’études spatiales), a French division of ESA (European Space Agency).

—user summary

Players take the role of farmers in Wisconsin after the industrial revolution that are expanding into new areas of the business world. Monopolization is a no luck economic strategy game (no dice rolling or random events from cards).

REAL ESTATE
Players travel around Wisconsin and purchase and sell real estate for their companies. Each type of property has a different purpose. They are: railroads, shops, inns, banks, forests, mines, farms, factories, and harbours.

PRICE MANAGEMENT
Presidents of companies can adjust the prices of their properties that may be utilized by other players. They may sell low to attract business or undersell competition, or sell high if they have a monopoly in a particular business.

TRAVELLING
Players try to avoid shops and inns that are too expensive while on their business trips, and visit other cities using the railroad, again trying to avoid overpriced trips.

ANTITRUST LEGISLATION
Players can also visit the capital building in Madison in an attempt to set legal limits on prices in certain industries.

SHARE TRADING AND TAKEOVERS
Presidents of companies can buy and sell shares of stock of other players' companies. This can be done for profit or to attempt a company takeover.

—description from the designer

"The petrifying prehistoric race game"

Throw the dice to try to escape the lava. Each round the lava creeps further, and you have to score enough and not get stuck on 'bad' squares in order to keep ahead. The one that gets their dinosaur to the end first without being caught by the lava flow is the winner.

A little like Snakes and Ladders with lava making the board smaller every turn.

—user summary

You are a Preacher and you made a deal with the Devil to live 100 years more, and to fulfill your end of the deal, you must collect a 100-year worth of souls. Souls of sinners. To do that, you lure the sinners into your church to “repent”.

The game is played over a series of rounds. In each round, players draw fresh hands of cards, take turns playing cards until the round is finished, and then do the scoring. First to collect 100 (or higher) souls, wins.

You start with a murderer in your church, there are 10 sinners/doers of good and 7 sacraments and each has a special power. Perform sacraments, lure sinners to your church as fast as you can, make sure your murderer stays in your church so you can collect the souls! [insert evil laughter here] ---Muwhahaha---

—description from the publisher

Pippi Longstocking Pearl Hunt

Pippi and the two thieves go fishing for pearls: Roll a die to grab pearls, steal from the other player or bring your cargo to safety in your treasure chest.

Game ends as soon as all pearls are collected. Party with the most pearls wins.

Competitive variant for 2 players. 
Cooperative variant for 1-many children.
—user summary

Pippi Langstrumpf Perlenjagd

Die Jagd auf die Südsee-Perlen ist eröffnet. Gemein nur, dass ständig die Diebe Jim und Buck ihre Langfinger im Spiel haben.
—description from the publisher

Travel version of Party & Co.
You don't need a playing board!

Party & Co card game is a game for 4 or more players.
A team consist of a minimum of 2 players.

One of the teams rolls the dice and takes a card. On every card there are 4 challenges, every category 1 challenge.
There are 4 categories: Art&Co, Show&Co, Quiz&Co and Crazy&Co.

You have 30 seconds for completing a challenge.
Before you start the challenge you can place a bet per team.
For example the challenge is: How many cartoon figures can you draw? Then each team can place a bet (bonus card) on that challenge. The team that wins collects the bonus cards.

The goal of the game is to collect 10 bonus cards.

—user summary

In Las Vegas, each player has eight dice of a different color, which they take turns rolling. When you roll your dice, you can choose to place them on the relevant casino cards; for example, a die showing a 1 will be placed on the casino mat marked "1". You must place all dice of one number on one casino in your turn. All players take turns doing this until all the dice have been used. Finally, the player with the most dice on each casino card takes the money associated with it. In case of a tie, the next non-tied player takes the highest-valued money card at that casino.

The Boulevard expansion includes:
 Eight dice in two new colors to allow for up to seven players.
 A purple die for each player that allows you to remove an opponent's or own die when placed (with enough purple dice to have up to eight players).
 A large die in each color, except purple, that counts as two dice when determining who scores at a casino.
 Two white dice to play the basic variant with up to 7 players.
 Rules for playing a solitaire version of the game.
 Rules for playing a variant of the game.
 Bills worth $100,000.
 Bills worth $50,000 for each bill of a specific color you collect.
 One-shot action cards, with each player receiving one such card at the start of each round.
 Special cards of variable random value.
 A new, seventh casino; on a turn, a player can place all the dice he rolled of a single number in this casino, but then no more dice of this number can be placed in this casino by any player.

name.value: Clue: Rick and Morty Back In Blackout

item.description:
The plans to Rick’s portal gun have been stolen! It’s up to Rick, Morty, Summer, Jerry, Beth and Mr. Poopybutthole to get them back. They must find out WHO stole the plans, WHERE they are hiding, and WHAT item they used to succeed in the heist. It’s an inter-dimensional mystery!

It plays exactly like Clue with a few additional rules and slight changes. First off, you use two dice to get around the board because of the way the board is shaped. Second, none of the character models are possible murderers in the game, instead they have been replaced by six random characters from the series on cardboard tokens. Third, there’s an added Contraption Card pile that you can get by landing on a “?” spot. Lastly, all of the characters have a Personality Card that gives them an added ability in the game like the ability to travel to a different part of the board without rolling dice, or getting the chance to see the same card someone just revealed to someone else.

Contraption cards will do things such as adding an extra six to your dice, taking an extra turn, or asking a bonus question.

name.value: The Mission: Early Christianity from the Crucifixion to the Crusades

item.description:
Jesus asked his disciples: “When the Son of Man returns, how many will he find on the earth who have faith?” (Luke 18:8, NLT) That question is the premise behind The Mission.

The Mission: Early Christianity from the Crucifixion to the Crusades is a “grand strategy” solitaire game covering 1,200 years of Christian history on a map of the ancient Mediterranean, Near East, Europe and Africa. While the secular world of empires and politics plays out around you, your missionaries spread the Christian faith and convert areas of the map to your new religion. Each turn covers decades, and the flow of play will teach players about the expansion and doctrinal battles of early Christianity while you build institutions to educate, heal, and inspire the societies you touch.

Apostles and brilliant theologians will help you evangelize, but you will come to rely on the Roman/Byzantine state and Christian kingdoms to establish and defend the faith. Heresies and schisms in the Church will try to thwart your plans. Pressing against you are barbarian hordes, some of which you may convert; but the armies of Islam will emerge as the game changes from one of missionary outreach to one of self-preservation, as Christian communities hunker down for survival during the long Dark Ages. At the end, you will rise up in a blaze of glory as the Christian world finally fights back using Crusaders and the Spanish Reconquista to recover lost provinces!

Beginners and experienced gamers will find this an intriguing and very different sort of game. It’s a war of ideas, but it’s still a wargame, where managing scarce resources (including holy relics!) and making shrewd strategic decisions are the keys to victory. Can you build a strong, united and prosperous Christendom?

—description from the publisher

name.value: All Aboard: Around the World Train Game

item.description:
This appears to be a simple roll-and-move game, with the theme of world railway travel, and based on an oval board game.

From the description on the back of the box:

First class, non-stop family fun from London to Rio via Delhi and Sydney!

Travel in style, stopping off at exotic locations to take in the sights. Watch out for obstacles that will slow down your journey, like leaves on the line, and hope to be sped up by express routes.

Set Up
Each passenger boards their train by placing a train token at the start of the train track.

How to Play
Passengers take turns in a clockwise order; youngest passenger starts. On your turn, roll the dice and move forward that many spaces. If you land on a space with text on it, read out the text and follow the instruction. If you throw a '6' you do not get another turn.

Winning
The first passenger to reach the end of the line and complete their journey wins. Keep playing until all trains have pulled in.

Contents: 
1 x game board
1 x die
8 x train tokens [blue, brown, green, pink, purple, orange, red, yellow]

Two Robots is a fast-paced, strategic card game of set collection and player elimination in a far distant future. Players in the game control Salvagers with special abilities attempting to build more robots than their friends. However, robots have a mind of their own. Be the first to eliminate all players or build Two Robots, the choice is yours.

In order to build Two Robots, you need to swap, freeze, destroy and collect robot parts. Players play robot parts into stacks, with all five energy types forming them. Action cards to attack and defend are based on the number of stacks. Stacking Robot parts with similar energy types allows you to complete robots. Once a robot has been completed, a player can turn robot parts into fuel to fight other players. All Salvagers have different abilities, so choose carefully.

How To Win: Be the first player to complete Two Robots, or eliminate all opponents.

—description from the publisher

Random Narrative Game is an interactive, choose your own adventure style, group storytelling game. Players work together to create a cohesive story based on the setting, pathways, and choices presented to them. The twist is all choices are determined by luck and the roll of a dice.

—description from the designer

Let's not beat around the bush. Sometimes you need to let off some steam, right? This may be a far cry from your typical card game, but give us the benefit of the doubt, huh?
Now, I don't wanna let the cat out of the bag, but you really should jump on this bandwagon and take our game for a spin!
You may think we're not playing with a full deck, but there is a method to our madness. So get off the fence before you miss the boat and join us for a game of Idi-umms...

Idi-umms is a fast-paced, fill-in-the-blank card game where players compete to see who can earn the most points by recreating idioms using the word cards in their hand.

—description from the designer

name.value: Beg, Borrow & Steal: The Light Edition

item.description:
Do you like collecting things?
 Do you ever beg your friends to give you things?
 Do you regularly borrow things and never return them?
 Have you considered stealing things you want?


If any or all these things are true, then THIS is the game for you!
In Beg, Borrow & Steal players collect sets of 3 identical cards by taking cards from other players or stealing them from the draw pile. The player with the most completed collections when the Steal pile runs out wins! Some people work hard to achieve success, but in this game, you have to Beg, Borrow, and Steal to succeed!


 Both The Light Edition and the Dark Edition can be played separately or together as an expanded version of the game. Each game is perfect for 3-4 players in normal play mode. When combined the game can accommodate up to 8 players in normal play mode or 3-6 players in challenging mode.


—description from the designer
